    ¬†Balanced sound unlike all other portable speakers which are mostly vocally loud. Instrument seperation is good and sound is perfectly balanced between bass, treble and vocals. No distortaion at max volume. Go for it. Can easily beat any speaker worth double the price with its amazing sound.

reviewTitle: Not enough ooomph, major switch off problem
reviewDescription: It's ok as a spare speaker. I got it for my TV whose inbuilt speaker malfunctioned and the engineer quoted thousands for rectifying it. But it is not even as good as the TV speaker. The volume is ok and it definitely can be used but do not expect amazing sound out of it. Also, as a TV speaker, it switches off auto if TV is off even if it is always on charging. This is so cumbersome as you need to switch it on everytime to use it. It auto offs in 1 hour if it senses nothing is connected to it. This is good in battery only mode but should not be the case in charging mode. Even bluetooth gets disconnected if nothing is playing.

Sound/built quality is very good, but the speaker seems to have only 1flaw, battery backup.Only 1.5-2hr playback at 60% volume and it starts giving warning as battery low.Can anyone suggest the charge current and voltage required for this device?

This is my second Zebronics bluetooth speaker...The first was Zeb Soundfeast 50. Haven't been dissatisfied with either of them. I nearly bought the Soundfeast for the second purchase but then decided to go for the Jukebar 1500.I use this as my bedside companion and so far it has been a very pleasant experience. The sound quality is good and for its size it does have a fairly impressive bass reproduction. I don't blast it at full volume...keep it at about 50% or even a bit lower and I like what I hear from this simple looking speakers. No frills or bright gaudy LED lights here just a little blue light to indicate when switched on.I like its simple yet classy piano / glossy finish looks.Yes the battery backup could have been better (but one can always plug it in while listening when the battery goes low) and a USB port would have earned it the missing star.Sound wise - it's a very decent speaker for an extremely affordable price tag.I would recommend it to anyone wanting a travelling, picknicking or like me - a bedside speaker for easy listening.
Perfect sound.Affordable.Go for it....ü¶à

reviewTitle: Amazing Sound and bass but TERRIBLE Playback time
reviewDescription: It has been almost 3 days using this Zebronics Juke Bar 1500, it has an amazing sound quality for a mid-range soundbar with a great bass and treble. But there asre always a few kickbacks, when it arrived it was completely discharged so I plugged it in and it almost took 3.5 hrs to completely charge and its playback time was around 3-4 hrs at full volume.Conclusion : Great Sound but poor Playback and Charging Time
